I had some experience with From games going in. I did almost beat the base game Dark Souls 3. I did play a bit of Bloodborne. So it’s not like I came in blind or unsuspecting. But watching footage and listening to “reviewers” say this game is accessible gave me hope that maybe this would be a more fun version of the previous titles I played through. Nope. This is just as painful as any other souls game. And what’s worse is I convinced a friend to pick it up thinking that and he had zero experience with these kind of games and basically ally wasted $60.

I’ve put around 30 hours into the game. I’ve over-leveled myself because I just wanted to experience the game and the world in a more casual fashion. I don’t care to be a pro at this game. The open world is fantastic. It’s one of the best open world maps I’ve ever seen. Extremely dense. No place is the same. Packed with stuff to actually find and see. It’s filled with caves and dungeons and open world bosses everywhere. I can’t even count the amount of enemy types. So the world, the combat, the exploration, are all top notch as usual.

But it’s brutal out there. I often find myself dying still in a few shoots to almost anything. Arrows and rocks are buried from across the map from enemies that will destroy you. Trying to get out of combat just to use your map again is tedious. I guess I expected the open world part to be more casual and to have a decent way for leveling but this is not the case. Glitch farming methods are the only real way you can even level in this game and it’s no wonder everyone cheeses them.

Questing is absurd. I understand and accept that this is how From does it. I’m not here to try and change it. But doing quests is insanely confusing, and I just end up watching guides because I don’t want to spend hundreds of hours and multiple play throughs to do them. Many quests can be missed.

Bosses themselves haven’t been too bad depending on play style. But again, I over-leveled with a broken farming method and play a Mage so I’ve got range and a general OPness to me. But even at that you still die in a couple shots if not careful. So anyone who thinks they can over-level to the point of 1 shoting bosses or tanking all their attacks will be let down. I hate when gaming companies do this — lure you into a false sense of being powerful. I think that happens here. Even though you can get more powerful in ER than any other game they’ve made, you won’t really feel it and still die a ton.

I think a 7 is very appropriate for this title. There’s still plenty more to say, both good and bad, but I digress. It’s a good game. It’s not game if the year. It’s not game if the decade. It’s just a really solid game from a really solid developer. It’s just a game that’s not meant for everyone, despite how much I hate that statement and think it’s a terrible one. If your not a Souls player and lover, this game is not a entry to it.

Elden Ring is all of FromSoftware's experience combined into one game with a vast open world to boot. Most open world games while huge are empty, Elden Ring's world is not. It's bright, lively, and enchanting while also being dark, gritty, and terrifying. It becons the player to go out and explore regardless of what challenges may be around each corner. The combat is a deep and intense as ever, with plenty of options for the player to explore and tailor their playstyle. And as always the boss's are as difficult as ever with some boardering on the insane. The sheer creativety of the monstrosities that have been created are jaw-dropping. Thankfully you do not have to face these challenges alone with the online co-op and the new spirit summoning system to ease your troubles on this long journey. The story is interesing but elusive which will require multiple playthroughs to fully squeze the blood from this stone, giving the game even more replay value. I highly recommend giving this game a shot but understand that while it is the most accessible FromSoftware title it is a challenge. You will die. A lot.

This game is amazing. it has some issues regarding performance but that can be fixed with a patch. the game is way more nonlinear. if you are having trouble with a boss you can just leave the boss and go level up and return to defeat it. which helps a lot. on top of that, the art style of this game is amazing. proving that art style beats graphics. I mean did you see the Erdtree?! . Now some people might get this game and think it will be a little different in terms of difficulty, but no. this is still that classic hard souls experience. but you have way more tools to make the game a little easier. for example, spirit summons. spirit summons are AI you can spawn to help you in boss battles. they don't do a lot of damage but they distract the boss so you can get some hits in. overall  this game is a must-play that I would recommend to any fan of the soul's genre

This is, without a doubt, the best game I’ve ever played. The world is teeming with life, with seemingly everywhere having a special enemy, dungeon, or secret. A strange item causes a ghost to appear and lead you to a cave. A telescope with a birds eye view lets you look around the world differently. A small elevator leads to a massive, beautiful cavern with inexplainable stars. I became engrossed with this massive world after only a few hours, and have now spent almost 15 of my last 22 hours since receiving my copy simply exploring. My friend who’s never played a souls game has already called it the best he’s ever played, and my group are having the times of our lives simply exploring and levelling up. I would highly suggest anyone to get this game, and think it redefines what a game should do.

Elden ring is not a perfect game but it is a good one, and if you are a fan of previous soulsborne games you will most likely enjoy this game. For new players this game might be harder to enjoy early on due to its lack of guidance and what can be a frustrating combat system and currency/xp system, if you are unexperienced with souls likes. Elden ring also has a few technical issues, like server issues that will hopefully be cleaned up fairly soon and some texture and occasionally enemy pop in.The open world also has a bit of a lower level of quality compared to the more detailed and interesting legacy dungeons, but none the less the open world is still rich with things to do and find. Sometimes the world can look a little outdated graphically but there are moments that truly do shine. Like when you are standing on top of a tower looking over to see the castle you have just finished fighting a challenging boss in, or the dense forest you escaped moments before. The bosses in elden ring vary from being great to more on the level of filler. Not that they are poorly designed just that you may fight a boss and then a have very similar enemy appear somewhere else that is just considered a slightly stronger foe in your path or multiple similar bosses scattered around the world, which can feel a little repetitive. Overall though the experience, designs of dungeons, enemies, sometimes breathtaking vistas, interesting characters and a very well detailed world and lore. Triumphs most of the issues that can be found with Elden ring. This is a game any fan of fromsoftware should pickup, and any interested new comers should maybe watch a few YouTube videos on, to understand what kind of experience they are going to get them selves into before purchasing.

Is it fun? Yes. Is it in a playable state? Kinda. Should you wait until the patch that fixes the stuttering and FPS issues comes out to buy it? Yes.So far Good but need improvements and better optimization
Its a good game, had performance issues during launch due to security issues.

A masterpiece based upon a foundation laid by George R.R. Martin, and further developed by director Hidetaka Miyazaki, and the development team, From Software, Elden Ring has captivated me unlike any game has before. The Lands Between consist of beautifully artistic scenery and level design, alluring incentives for exploration, fluid combat, and many diverse, challenging bosses. The narrative is firmly present within the environment yet little is mentioned of it, thus allowing for some extrapolation by the player. The more tense combat encounters are accompanied by Yuka Kitamura's masterful work as a sound designer and composer, which has been developed throughout nearly a decade of work on other similar games by From Software. Though its identity is distinctly its own, Elden Ring nonetheless shares many similarities with its predecessors, the Dark Souls trilogy and Bloodborne, and truly feels like the culmination of From Software's work on them. Of the many video games I have tried throughout the last decade, my experience with Elden Ring is confidently my favorite. Despite what I've attempted to convey, this game simply must be experienced personally to truly appreciate it.
The game needs a patch. It's not playable in this state. At least it doesn't make a lot of fun. But it could become the game of the year easily. At the moment, it's technically garbage.

Es un juego increíble, yo lo he jugado por 8 horas y no he tenido problema alguno, es cierto que la hierva a veces muestra poping, pero creo yo que es algo minúsculo en comparación con lo apasionante que es el juego, lo diverso de sus criaturas y lo mucho que se disfruta el ir evolucionando gracias a la exploración.

La propia exploración es lo que hace a su vez que aunque sea dificil el juego no se haga un martirio imposible de llevar.

Claramente FromSoftware nunca ha peleado por tener los mejores gráficos, creo que apuestan todo a las dinámicas y a los detalles del lore que nutre cada milimetro del enorme mapa, no hay zona en la que no vivas algo nuevo.

Jogo porco de uma produtora preguiçosa, os gráficos parecem de início de geração do Ps3 ou Xbox, pop-ins a cada 2s e fora a terrível performance principalmente nos consoles de última geração e PC. E o pior é essa mídia especializada (comprada) dando essas notas altas... Lamentável!

Increíble juego, soy nuevo en este tipo de juegos, y como es lógico es complicado para gente nueva, pero dedicando tiempo, no tanto, y buscando en el mapa, se te hace muy entretenido y tiene u a jugabilidad muy interesante y divertida, muy recomendado.

I’m astonished at the reviews for Dark Souls 4. This is the dark souls you already know and love (or hate). To put it simply: if you don’t like dark souls or fromsoftware’s previous titles, stay away from this. It’s more of the same. There is nothing new here, other than an expanded map you can move through freely.Because dozens of games do horseback riding better. Do exploration better. Do map design better (there are no cities, towns, or anything other than ruins here), do leveling better. This is the exact same dark souls formula that fromsoft has always pumped out.Don’t be fooled by the hype. It’s dark souls.

My first time playing a game like this. The controls and a little sluggish along with the targeting. There is no hand holding, once you come top side it’s up to you to explore and do the things that you want. Exploring is encourage and each biome is its own personality and a way of humbling you.The story is good, considering who is behind it. If anybody is on the fence of buying it consider it akin to Monster Hunter but you take more damage when you get hit.

Lets start by saying i will not be referring to this game as a masterpiece as that horse has been beaten to death? Elden Ring is a good game, but that's it. Its dated as F! In fact it brought back memories of Dragons Lair for me. Move left - swing sword - move right - back step - swing sword what year is it? The exploration in the game is by far the only reason it gets as high a score from me personally. Its super fun to explore and find new places and enemies to kill but this game is so repetitive, repetitive, repetitive, repetitive. Boss battles are the same, enemies everywhere are the same. It's a great step in a the right direction but if you're going to open your world map then you got to have a reason to live in it, it has to be an interesting place for me to ROLE PLAY. Not overly difficult if you level up and explore the world for better gear and weapons, but why else would you be playing an RPG. Combat is simple and fair most of the time and by fair i mean if you get hit you get punished, that's what these games are about. Sadly because that mechanic is so old and stale once you master moving and taking small bites you can really own this game. Its good but not as good as some other RPG'S over the years. Like Dragons Lair in the arcades as a kid a lot of people got pissed off the game was so hard and wanted their Quarters back. But if you just learned the patterns to the dungeons the Quarters started to go really far. If people were still buying physical copies of games Elden Ring would have its own pre-owned bin at every location. Solid 7/10

The lowest score I could justify giving this game is an 8, and I believe it is a 10. I knew it was a 10 when I sunk 30 hours in 3 days when I am also juggling work and school. Anything lower than an 8 makes no sense - this is one of the most dense, beautiful, dangerous open worlds ever created. Combat is extremely varied. The exploration is top notch - think BOTW where you keep telling yourself "ok one more thing then I'll stop playing - let me go to that castle first" and then end up playing another 2 hours. There is SO much creativity and fun packed in this game it is an absolute must-play. Combat while on your horse is also the best I've ever seen in a game. It is so fun. Unlike the Witcher where it's a nuisance to fight on your horse, here I try to stay on unless I absolutely must get off.

As with any other FromSoft game, however, there is a learning curve where you need to learn how to fight. It does take some patience, but once you get that you cannot roll infinitely or just run in and attack, it gets easier from there. And then you sink into it with all the different weapon and magic options you have as you level up. Infinite builds and playstyles. Cool and funny side quests and characters, and the story is the most prominent it has ever been in an FS game.

Again, From Software has released another excellent game in the Souls series. An amazing adventure awaits anyone who is brave enough to trek across the treacherous lands of the first open world game in the series. With a class to suit anyone's play style, players will be thrown in to a world with danger awiting them around every corner.  Although the game is superb for the most part, I would have like to see and actual upgrade graphic wise. But graphics are everything,  and Elden Ring delivers in every other department.  So set forth,  and test you skill, as well as your patience!

Great game as always from fromsoftware.. the open world is beautiful ...gameplay is superb..Art and atmosphere is great ...amazing boss fights..
But there's one problem and always from Japanese devs for Xbox ..the optimization is very bad for Series X|S ..yes with vrr the game is smooth but without vrr the game runs between 50-60fps and that not good enough..
Series X is more powerful than ps5...it should be easily 1800p-4K locked 60fps..the loading the same as Xbox one ...Japanese devs forget to coding the game on XSX|S and use the speed of HDD instead of the next gen SSD ...its really awful optimization for great game ...how the hell make the loading the same on Xbox one and Xbox Series... I tried both and its the same ..that's why ps5 has faster loading times because the devs forget to use the high speed of XS SSD and used the low speed of Xbox one HDD

I expected this to be great but it surpassed all my expectations. The sense of exploration is unparalleled. The map opens up before you and distant features beckon you onwards. Sneaking throw forests and swamps, scratch plans ara abandoned to the intense curiosity that comes with discovering an unexpected ruin, spectral boatman, cave or castle. Razor-sharp combat mechanics reward perseverance and skill whilst punishing the impulsive with the swift admonishment of death. There is almost too much to do yet still, there are no dull moments. A masterpiece of game design and ingenuity. it is hard to see how anything can stop this from being GOTY.
Indeed, it may well be the greatest game ever made

It's almost a throwback to games like Mike Tyson's Punch Out where you have to learn your opponents patters and when to attack and when to defend.  You can't run in and bash things until they are dead, which in many great games is as advanced as the battle gets.

This is definitely it's own thing.  And you HAVE to put you ego aside and realize you're going to die while playing this game.  A LOT.  Once you accept that, it opens up and is an absolutely incredible game.

This game is a 10 if there ever was one. The world building is absolutely top notch. The secrets have secrets. I wouldn't say this game is 100% new player friendly, but it is more so than other FromSoft titles. The way you have to dig for the story.. the combat.. finding secrets.. finally defeating that boss you've been stuck on is the most rewarding and addicting loop in any game. This is hands-down a generation defining game. It is a perfect culmination of all the works FromSoftware has delivered to us. If you are a FromSoft fan this is an absolute must buy. If you are on the fence please give it a try. This game is more than worth the asking price with all the content on hand.P.S. I am a fan of HFW too and I think the people who are picking a side between the two games need their head examined.

As someone who has played all previous Souls games, Elden Ring tops them all. Although made noticeably easier than previous games to appeal to a newer audience, the open world experience is a delight and I really hope every game they make going forward is open world too.

Do you like Dark Souls and Breath of the Wild? If the answer is yes to both then you my friend are in for a treat. Infinite character customisation, huge map brimming with points of interest and secret areas, great drawn out story that twists and keeps you guessing throughout, rewards for taking risks and destroying enemy groups, non linear path of progression, easy to use multiplayer elements that let's you tackle both dungeons and bosses if the going gets tough, new special moves and NPC troops to help turn the tide of battle. All in all Elden Ring is a game of exploration that will keep you coming back for more. You'll spend your day's wondering what lies yonder over that hill, ruins, swamp, forest, castle, run down village etc and when you can find the time to get back to answering your curiosity.

This game is a masterpiece piece. The exploration is satisfying. It gives u freedom and accepts whatever u do. I fell in love with it and now I can't stop playing.

Its hilarious to me that in all the 0s and 1s review this game is getting, they can only complain about the graphics being last gen and lack of cutscenes. Nothing screams GIT GUD more than seeing reviews like this. Im glad fromsoft have stuck to their guns and kept the handholding out of their games as is their tradition.

Now for the fromsoft veterans who havent bought this game yet for whatever reason, know that I am only docking points because the endgame areas and bosses have noticeably bad balance compared to maybe 75% of the game. The 6 hardest bosses in this game have maybe 1 second of openings every 30 seconds which makes the fights insanely long

I also dont like how they have introduced the spirit ash mechanics. Spirit ashes are summons that you can upgrade. There are also NPC summons like in previous games but spirit ashes when upgraded are far stronger. There are 5 legendary ashes which summon spirits that are essentially stronger than your own character when leveled up to the max.

This has caused a lot of elitism and anti elitism since they are considered a mechanic of the game unlike NPC summons. Head over to the reddit page for ER and theres posts every day bashing the veterans who dont like using summons

Obviously you can say "Just dont use them"

The issue is again those 6 hardest bosses and their balance showing. If you use the ashes the fights are a minute long. If you dont, a successful attempt can be up to 8 minutes with these endgame bosses!

My first time trying a souls style game it is absolutely incredible! Everything in the game encourages exploring and if something is hard you can go farm and come back. I find everything about the world immersive and exciting. The combat is very fun and you have so many options to approach different situations. 10/10!

FromSoft has done it again, I have once again become completely addicted to a game they have made, and I doubt this will be the last game that this happens with. I’d usually wait for the sale if I were someone else as these games aren’t for everyone, but for once I think full price is worth playing. Beautiful art style, amazing music, addictive combat and awesome bosses, and stupendous lore that hooks you right in from the start of the game to till it ends. Bravo Miyazaki and Martin, you have made my favorite game ever.
FROMSOFT delivers yet again. Please buy this; support this company, there one of the very few good ones left.

does a good job as a exploration game, but:
- savegame bugs took like 10h of effort, boss killing and farming and weapon and material grinding from me. how does a souls game fail at saving, the previous parts were saving at every opportunity. thats the biggest minus from me
- the game has no clear red line, hugeass open world and no clear directions, cryptic introductions ruins the fun and drag the story longer the wrong way
- progression is superslow, if you struggle with your current stats against enemies, you will struggle more in the upcoming regions. monsters get superhard, runes (exp) and smithing materials are very scarce, i wasnt able to get my weapons past +4 after 50h of gameplay. so i used the rapier +8 which you get as a gift after beating some mainstory boss.
-great runes are a great idea but a greater dissapointment. why do we have to use rune arcs to buff them up? i found in all myhours so far 4-5 rune arcs (similar to humanity and embers) in the open world and those expire once you die and you will probably die every 5 mins once.
- effing dragons at some endgame location give 3,5k runes... and you need at lvl60 or so around 25k exp for a level up. and dragons would at that point one shot you with basic attacks. the game is super tough, i dont know why they went with that kind of progression design. this game is supposed to be a challenge, not a parkour and avoid monster simulation
- the trap chests are a nice idea, but can lead anyone who plays without guides into desperation. i for my part hated that idea

+ great enemy variaty

+ great mounted combat
+ ashes of war and summon noble spirits are a awesome addition to the game
+ awesome looking bosses (which drop almost no usefull weapons or souls which can be turned into weapons)
+ fast travel is also an awesome addition to the game, from any point (except inside traps)
+ the exploration is also awesome, you can explore so many regions thanks to the jump button
+ some regions seriously looked dreamlike, which almost never was the case in any souls game . which mostly has gory stuff and locations

메타 순간 평점 98점, 지금은 메타 평점 97점. 그리고 오픈크리틱 역대 1위에 등극한 적도 있고
역대 메타스코어 게임의 반열에 오른 오픈월드 액션 RPG게임 '엘든링'
엘든링은 이미 2022년 최다고티의 영역을 이미 초월한 게임이다.
최다 고티가 아니라... 사실 역대 메타스코어 영역에서 노는 게임이다.

이 정도로 잘만든 AAA급 초우주갓겜은 게임계에서 평생 나올까 말까 한 게임이다.

게임계의 역사 실록에 기록되어 두고 두고 회자될 정도의 클라스의 게임이다.

확실한건 세키로의 이동방식, 전투 자세를 계승했으며, 몽골제국의 기병대 같은 간지나는 마상전투와

일본도와 사무라이 갑옷을 장착한 간지나는 사무라이의 칼싸움은 가히 세키로, 고스트 오브 쓰시마, 블레이드앤소울, 몬스터헌터 라이즈의 검술 칼싸움을 생각나게 할 정도로 근접 타격감이 최강이다.

오픈월드 액션 RPG들 중 가장 전투와 타격감이 1위인 게임은 단연코 엘든링이라고 자신있게 말할수있다.

던전과 모험 방식은 젤다의전설 야생의숨결 같으면서도,

전투 방식은 확실하게 세키로나 소울류를 계승해서 발전시켰다.

플스판은 진짜 프레임도 높고 잘되는데 PC스팀판만 프레임 드랍이 아쉬운건 어쩔수없는게

'오픈월드 RPG'라는 장르 특성상 초반엔 PC스팀판은 프레임 드랍이 어쩔수없다.

지금까지 갓겜들이라고 나온 오픈월드 RPG게임들도 초반엔 최적화 이슈가 있었기 때문이다.

하지만 확실한건 엘든링은 진짜 잘만들고 재밌는 AAA급 초우주갓겜인건 확실하다.

아니, AAA급 초우주갓겜이라는 수식어로도 엘든링을 설명하기 힘들다.

엘든링은 그 이상... '인류 역사상 최고의 게임'이라고 단연코 말할수있다.

My real rating is probably an 8 out of 10. However, too many people review bombing it seems because they don't understand this game is in its own genre and isn't a Ubisoft open-world hand-holding experience so I'm giving my review a +1 stat boost. This game its hard its unforgiving and not meant to be a shut off your brain and glide through experience. If that's what you are looking for, please please don't let the cool aesthetic of the game make you buy it, it is not for you.

As for the technical issues, I'm on a 120hz VRR capable tv so it all looks fine to me. I am also against those giving the game a zero for something that will be further optimized with upcoming patches so another +1 stat boost in my review.

The open world is deep and rich with so many places, corners, nooks, and crannies to explore. It can be overwhelming but there's no foul in looking through guides online or on youtube.

The combat ranges from challenging to absolutely brutal, but you can run away go in another direction and return when you're stronger and you have more experience with less difficult opponents.

I am writing this as a person who has finished the game and done all side quests:
A good game with a high difficulty, although it has the same dark souls format he open world gives it a new feel however i can't help but to think that they couldn't make enough bosses and just ended up re using a lot of their bosses sometimes up to 5 times. The dungeons are fairly boring but necessary to progress a certain npc's quest line which you will want to do considering he gives you incantations(a form of spell). Despite the few crashes i have had it still runs really good, and as for the story the game follows dark souls usual cryptic path of giving you small bits and pieces that you yourself has to piece together. Although the horse is helpful it can be annoying to use because it's not exactly smooth and I have had a bit of an issue with getting of the horse because sometimes the game does not let you and other times you get stuck mid air and die. They do re use a few enemies and concepts from previous dark souls games like the crab, it's really up to you to decide if this is a nice callback/hint to the previous games or if its lazy. The npc's with decently long quest lines are fewer then i originally expected and with bad rewards at the end of there quests however that is my personal opinion, the weapons in this game are very different and a meta has already established in both in pve and pvp. in pve you can just spam scarlet rot on almost every single boss trivializing the game or just use magic because it does way to much damage. In pvp you want to power stance with fast weapons, use a heavy shield and armor or use the blood hounds curved great sword and spam the weapon art. This was my only negative experiences with the game, if all of this sounds fine to you i would highly suggest buying it even at full price

Best game FROM SOFTWARE has put out to date! GOTY Material.
Elden Ring is like a good wine gets better with time, not too much time but it does take a bit to get used too as it breaks the mold on what a modern day Open World RPG can be. it does not take your hand and tell you what to do. It lets you mess up and realize your suddenly in front of a HUGE DRAGON. It lets you feel scared and humbled when you open the wrong chest and teleports you to a place far away that your not even close to level. And yes, it frustrates you like FROM Software games do... You will call it the b... you will damn your game counsel, but when you are able to beat a boss, the sense of accomplishment cannot be beat. All HAIL YOUR NEW ELDEN RING OPEN WORLD RPG OVERLORD: ELDEN RING.

Let me start off by saying the game artistically looks amazing. However the serious lack of details up close is a bit sad. They're something you would see early PS4/XBO days. The quality mode helps a little, but that mode is nearly unplayable, so hard to consider that an option. There also no quest list or journal, no map pin system, no hand holding of any kind which is kind of fun and kind of irritating at the same time. I like some bit of structure, it doesn't need to be Bethesda level of hand holding though. It also had a fun aspect to it when you're not repeating the same attempt for the 12th time. I played some of the other dark souls and blood borne games when I was younger, but didn't play them very long due to the difficulty. Now that I'm in my 30s I don't mind sticking to it longer but without that historical Souls franchise experience, it is very difficult and very frustrating. I've been playing since launch and still haven't beat the first boss. Watch video, gotten advise and still can't get it done. I would have liked to try it coop but ya know it didn't work for days and I still haven't gotten to try it.  From what I've seen, it's really not that dynamic of a coop anyway so I'm weary. Overall the game is fun  ut is very frustrating not just for difficulty but the broken online mode, meh graphical details, lack of basic features, and crazy clunky fighting mechanics. Basically, if you're not already a Souls die hard with a clear bias for this type of game, this game is just good but not good enough. Too bad the critics couldn't see past their bias.

From what i know and when i played, Elden Ring performs so much better on the Xbox with better frame rate at max and even with VRR, Elden Ring is even more higher fps and is better than every other version of Elden Ring. Elden Ring is such a great game with bosses and open world

Environments, enemy types and mechanics of said enemies are nearly perfect. You can have so much fun just exploring the map and the process of getting just a little better every excursion is thrilling. The game falters at few key places including graphics, performance, and multiplayer decisions. The performance of the game even in performance mode is lack luster at best hovering 40-50. While this is not that bad considering the character models and some environments look like early ps4 it’s disappointing. Multiplayer could be phenomenal but is bogged down by bad design choices. One example is walls that forces you to disband group at region zones and have your friends try to get to the point where you’re at alone just so you can progress after you get past the wall. Others include mounts and summons not working. These two features are so core to the single player experience that it is baffling that they couldn’t optimize their game enough to have them included. There is a lot to like about this game and contrary to popular opinion an 8 is a worth while experience so give it a try.

I've always been looking forward to Elden Ring, but I was getting a bit worried as we got closer to release as I saw how many people were hyped for it. I was afraid with them going open world, and the apparent mainstream appeal, that it would be Baby Dark Souls.

Well, my fears were unfounded. Going open world didn't impede this game at all, it elevated it. Almost every square inch of this game is beautiful, unique, and most importantly, full of new experiences. I feel actual joy exploring this land, when usually in an open world game I just zero in on the waypoint so I can quickly kill the enemies and finish whatever lame quest I am on.

There have been a few additions to the Souls gameplay, such as a jump button and stealth. I was surprised to see stealth, but after playing a bit I can't really imagine getting around this world without it.

I could probably babble on about this game for awhile, but really I'm just writing this review to spite the babies!

Oh, boy another buggy triple-A release. I mean I guess it's to be expected that the same slobs at IGN/Mattyplays/Gamespot/Whatculture/etc that spent 2 or 3 years lying to the general public about Cyberpunk couldn't be trusted on this game either, but I like so many others fell for it.

Story is virtually non-existent they were happier than hell to plug George R R Martin's name all over the marketing materials, but I'm not sure what he did. About as much work as he does on his own series I'd surmise, which is NOTHING. You get what amounts to lore dumps on scrolls and flavor text on items passing as a "story." There's no major narrative structure.

The "revolutionary" open world is hollow, lifeless, and boring. I've seen more intriguing open worlds in PS3 games. Speaking of PS3 games that's basically what you're getting here in the visuals department. I guess the AAA industry is so exhausted from bribing publishers and youtubers to give them good scores they don't even bother with the graphics anymore. Art direction is however stunning, seems to be where they spent most of their time.

Gameplay is seriously bogged down by numerous bugs and technical issues. Frame rate drops, save crashing, stuttering, janky animations, clipping errors, you name it this game has it. I guess all the 10/10 reviews are based on where the game will be in 2 years once they fix the bugs? That's some optimism for you!

El juego es una culminación de todos los SoulsBorne que ha realizado FromSoftware. Believe the hype. I’ve gone through and read negative reviews on this platform describing frame stuttering, crashing, input lag, what have you. In my 30 hours I’ve not had the game crash once nor frame rate stuttering, especially when a lot of mobs are on screen. It’s impressive to me how the game holds up in these moments of high stress. The art style is gorgeous. It is clear fromsoft put time and effort into this creation. Everything is placed in the world and has a reason for being there. It is incredible to me that they were able to create this in just over 2 years of development. This is also the most accessible soulsborne game, while also being one of the most challenging I’ve played. Keep in mind my review is solely based on my experience in my 30 hours, yes I am a fromsoft fan, so I’ve tried to avoid bias in this review, and I’ve taken off the rose colored glasses to fully experience these opening hours. Elden Ring receives a 10 from me on Xbox series X|S based the absolute zero issues or problems I have come across. Of course issues could still be there, and I will update this and my score accordingly if anything mentioned above changes over time.

Honestly, first I must say that if you aren't a fan of Dark Souls and/or any previous FromSoftware game this is not going to change your mind.

With that out of the way, let's get down to it. This game is "bare" because it wants to give you a sense of exploration. Yes, minimaps are cool, yes quest trackers are good to have, but where's the mystery if every single thing has big arrows pointed at them? The lore is there for people that want to search, but you really have to do some digging to figure things out. Though to be fair the story is not anything different, it's been the same in all games. You're some kind of chosen one that keeps coming back to life and you have to kill some gods to become the next ruler. Good enough for me let's go kick some ass, but there's still a huge world to explore, with plenty of side dungeons/bosses if you want to take a break from the main path.

Which leads to combat, which has always been the best thing in all of the FromSoftware games. The amount of builds you can create is insane, and with new features and mechanics you can pretty much make any build viable. Want do smash things with giant hammers or swords? Go for it. Want to slice and dice with knives and daggers? Take a stab at it. Wanna stand far away and blast enemies with fireballs and magic missiles? Cast away your doubts and blast away your foes. Hell there's even a video of someone playing as Darth Maul, double-blading every enemy in their path.

The visuals are decent, nothing mind blowing but in this day and age it's really hard to improve upon graphics. Even still, the art direction and style carry the game tenfold, so while the graphics aren't amazing you will still be in awe at how great the world looks. I'm constantly panning the camera 360 degrees just to take in all the visuals and I am constantly in awe of it all.

Now to answer the biggest question on everybody's mind: how difficult is it? You really want to know? It's brutal. Maddening. It will make you rage with anger and weep with sorrow. You will cry for mommy and dial 911 for emergency help simultaneously. Your anus will hurt from the relentless 24/7 pounding it gives you. You will fail more than you succeed, but when you do succeed, and rest assured you will, you will feel like the god you are aiming to by the end of the game. But wait, there's more. Tired of getting your ass handed to you for the millionth time? FRET NOT YOUNG TARNISHED! You can summon other players to assist you with bosses meaning you don't have to worry about being stuck for too long.

Overall the game is definitely a blast. I'm playing on the Xbox One X and I have not run into too many technical issues. Yes some FPS drops here and there but no crashing and no fight hindering slow downs during bosses either. The only reason it's a not a 10/10 is because the story is basically rehashed. Well, that and for a game to deserve a 10 it really does need to be superb while also bringing something new to the table. Elden Ring doesn't exactly bring anything new to the table but it definitely improves on the old formula. It's kinda like if your favorite drink is Mountain Dew and your favorite fruit is cherry and they just released Code Red. Except it can kill you twice before you even take your first sip. Yeah, something like that.

Not a fan of souls game in general but this one is awesome.Ignore the 'bad graphics" cry babies. If graphics were everything then most of the best games ever made would never exist. Playability and replayability are great. One of the few games out there worth the full price.

While I'm some ways off of creating my video review or even completing the game, Elden Ring has proven itself worth the hype, and despite it being my most anticipated game ever, it still somehow managed to exceed my expectations. Having spent more than 60 hours on the game, I can't put the game down, and I can't wait to get into NG+.

The game is brutal on mistakes, but stick it out, because this is in my honest opinion the greatest game I have ever had the privilege of playing.

There is an actual sense of adventure. The map does not shout at you with dozens of markers - you see something on the map resembling ruins, and you check it out because the game taps into your curiosity. Every discovery you make feels like your own and is rarely guided, with dialogue and world design that compliments the intelligence of the player, as is a staple in FromSoftware's games.

Having spent that much time in the game, I'd say I'm more or less about 60% of the way through, and I am so happy about that. I never want this game to end.

RECOMMENDATION: As I have always said for FromSoft games - your first playthrough should be solo, and unguided. This game is the pinnacle of that statement. Knowing where everything is from guides kills the exploration and discovery aspect of the game somewhat.

Elden Ring provides continues to refine and arguably perfect the Souls formula. Add in new gameplay mechanics, a gripping story co-written by George R.R. Martin, a gorgeous open world with caves and dungeons and an incredible selection of weapons and magic and you have what may just be an early GOTY. I am yet to complete this game, and an amendment with a 10/10 rating isn’t out of question. It’s truly a shame that this game is getting review-bombed for having the audacity to have no more than acceptable performance. Cyberpunk this definitely is not.

Gameplay-10Story-8World Design-10Graphics-6Fun Factor-10 Replay Value-10Overall Score-9 Exploration is the strongest aspect  of this game, open world games , time after time open world games  have become more focused on giving you a huge sandbox world but then holding your hand throughout your whole journey out of fear of the player being frustrated or confused. (Far cry 6 or Ac Valhalla as example)Like Zelda Botw, Elden Ring goes against this grain in that it respects the players intelligence to create their own adventure out of the sandbox world that is given. Combat while bring very similar to Dark Souls 3, is the most refined combat that we’ve seen from FromSoftware. Graphics can be seen as a weak point of this game, in that even in next gen consoles it doesn’t seem to give that wow factor as much as other games that are coming out in 2022 such as Horizon Forbidden West. Though I will say the world design of this game is so strong that it outshines the (can be) poor textures. As any Other Soulslike FromSoftware game that  they’ve published, Elden Ring has Excellent Replay Value, the combat has a mastery to it as soon as you begin playing the game.It being a well executed RPG it gives the player so much variations in how they can play the game that by the time you’re finished your 1st play through, you want to begin your second journey straight away just so you experience the game as a different build instead.Elden Ring is must play

Sin duda alguna es la mejor obra de From.Llevo aproximadamente unas 20-30 horas de juego y encuentro varias de las nuevas mecánicas sumamente entretenidas.Dentro de las innovaciónes, la que más me llamó la atención es la de aplicar cenizas/artes de guerra a el arma que quieras y hacer que mejoren de la forma que desees, esto abre la posibilidad de builds híbridas que anteriormente eran imposibles.Por ejemplo:Mi personaje es mago de combate pero en algunas ocasiones me encuentro con enemigos resistentes a la magia o que simplemente reciben muy poco daño, por lo tanto, requiero de un poco de daño divino, eléctrico, de fuego o un poco de buffs como curación o juramento sagrado.Otra mecánica que disfruto mucho es la de contraataque, esto permite a jugadores oxidados o nuevos asestar golpes de alto daño sin requerir mucha habilidad y sin exponerse tanto al enemigo.El sistema de mundo abierto permite una exploración sumamente amplia, así como sorpresas inesperadas como los subterráneos.Pero... Como todo lo bueno, también hay algunas cosas malas.Entre los detalles que me parecieron algo..... Desepcionantes, está la cantidad de material reciclado, entre esto se encuentran las animaciones.Diablillos/esclavos de lothrick.Avatares del arbol/Demonio del refugio.Caballeros superiores/caballeros de lothrick."gordos de machete" /legionarios de harald y juso el borracho.Gargolas/Gárgolas de morne.Aliento diagonal de los dragones/aliento de fuego de midir.Basiliscos/basiliscos. Cangrejo/cangrejo. Un jefe en la aldea de los alvinos/demonio de Aries..... Por favor, incluso pusieron los perros :v. También encontré algunas estructuras (chozas y cabañas) que literalmente fueron copiadas de la hoguera de asentamiento de los no muertos. Por último, las mazmorras básicas como minas y criptas tienden a ser un poco repetitivas variando únicamente en la disposición de enemigos, nivel y algunas secciones de las mismas, siento que pudieron haber hecho un diseño único para todas y cada una de ellas. Como conclusión: el juego es extremadamente bueno, presenta varios desafíos justos y sobre todo, es divertido explorar y progresar a lo largo del mundo. Los detalles como las animaciones recicladas y lo ligeramente monótono de las mazmorras puede ser dejado de lado si uno se enfoca en divertirse e investigar el mundo

Where to start.

Well let's begin with all the 10/10 reviews. I do believe it is a amazing game, and I really enjoy it, but it has its flaws.

Network code: not much improvement from dark souls 3 and in general, online is a bit hard to get into. Had one item activated that should summon me into other people their world when they got invaded but never happened.

PC build/stable FPS: It is From Software their first open world and mistakes will be made. Where I didn't have too bad of a FPS drop on pc, I know others did. And I sure had some awful frame drops myself during certain fights. In the end, it will be patched out rather sooner then later so I do not feel like it is too far of a point to judge on.

Open world: Their first open world and they nailed it. The moment you step out of the introduction area, you can go wherever you wish to go in a stunning looking world. Walk around and stumble upon a cave? Well it has some neat loot in it and worth a grab. By far the best open world game for me.

Difficulty: The game can be as difficult or easy as you make it. The first boss people seem to be having issues with is Margrit, who is indeed difficult. But it teaches you to do something else. Go out and explore, level up, get stronger weapons and then return to properly fight him.

Everything together, it is a solid 8 out of 10 for me. Not everything is perfect, but which game is? A true love letter to the fans of the dark souls series.
An incredibly fun and refreshing game that I know I am going to play again. It gives me a sense of wonder and adventure that I have not felt in gaming in years.

I'm not going to lie to you, it's pretty hard. The game lacks difficulty options, forcing players to either rise to the occasion and enjoy the rigor of fights where you dodge attack after attack performed by colossal bosses, or get mad because they can't manage to time their rolls and write a bad review on metacritic. That being said, the game does feel a bit grindy in the beginning, especially if giants scare you. It also lacks a simple main story, opting instead to give detail and plenty of backstory to its npc's and the world itself and making you the player figure things out. Your destiny won't be found nested in dialogue options, lengthy cutscenes, and a clear-cut path, it'll be what you make it. If you're up for the challenge, get Elden Ring and enjoy one of the greatest games out there.

It’s funny to see people who clearly haven’t played anything more challenging than mainstream bait titles zelda botw, ghost of tsushima, assassin’s creed and whatnot, complain about a game that has a 10+ year long history of having the same solid mechanics set in stone. They don’t realize that the difficulty of these games comes from THEM being a **** player because they were seasoned with the titles stated above, titles that reward you for being a **** player. They are not used to challenges. They want quest markers, dungeon markers, npc markers on the map. They want a difficulty setting. They don’t get what “roleplaying” means in these games. You’re not playing as some killing machine that can crush every single enemy as if they were tin cans, you’re playing as a person who seeks to be that strong one day, and you DO become that strong come late game. I hate that this game became a mountain of hype. Sorry but, the souls series doesn’t deserve this treatment. I don’t know why they decided to open it up to the general, more stupid audience. If this game had the same fanbase DS3 had at its release, I guarantee you it would’ve had a fan review score of 98-99. This game is literally the closest game we’ve had to perfect in its respective genre. Sorry for the long comment, I just felt like they didn’t do justice to this masterpiece of a video game franchise.

This is my first time playing a souls like game. I’m not sure I could go back to the other games but it’s definitely on my to do list after I continue to play Elden Ring. I’m 40 hours in and it’s just amazing. There is so much to do and so much to explore. The game is tough but it gives you multiple ways to come back and to level up. You can even summon spirits, NPCs or other online players to help you through an area or boss. A big thing to note going in is you are going to die, and die alotttttt. Be prepared don’t throw your control; try not to rage quit. Just leave go level up or explore. This game is beautiful and is full of life. Highly recommend. So far it’s my favorite game  and I can’t put it down. I will be back to give another review months later after I finish every bit of content I can squeeze out! 10/10

Absolutely amazing, a real breath of fresh air after a year or so of generally disappointing games.A lot of the lower rated reviews are people crying about the difficulty, but to be fair, is the game difficult? Yes, extremely at times, especially if you aren't  familiar with souls style combat, like I wasn't. So if you're not very patient then this isn't the game for you.However, if you commit a little bit of time to learning the combat system and to understanding the bosses move sets, you'll be recorded with what I consider to be one of the best gaming experiences I've had in a very long time.The boss battles are some of the most intricately designed, punishing button mashing and forcing you to beat them, not by luck, but by skill and determination. The scenery is beautiful and the open world is very, very detailed, with a trip into an unassuming shack taking you on a quest spanning multiple hours. The enemies are diverse and always keep you on your toes and every battle is a little bit different. The game allows you to play in a multitude of ways, in a very non-linear style of story telling where you have to figure things out on your own. This makes the game very rewarding and finally beating a boss which you've been beaten by 50 or so times brings unmatched satisfaction.

Definitivamente la evolucion perfecta de los juegos de From Software, en donde literalmente te puedes introducir en un mundo con miles de cosas por descubrir y colocadas estrategicamente para que tengan sentido. Si bien la nueva mecanica de andar a caballo no me termina de convencer, es sin duda, un reto mas a nuestras habilidades frente al mando.

Realmente si piensan que es un Dark souls 4 (lo cual muchas personas lo describen asi) por algunos sonidos, animaciones, npc's y entre tantas cosas. Esto es sin duda lo caracteristico de los juegos de From Software, podemos verlo en juegos como BloodBorne o Sekiro.

La dificultad es una de esas cosas que hacen que From Software sea lo que es hoy en dia y por lo cual la comunidad se mantiene tan fiel a este tipo de aventuras.

Sin duda la joya de la corona de los mundos abiertos. Jefes increibles, materiales interesantes, mecanicas fabulosas y excelente soundtrack.

Recomendado totalmente! Denle la oportunidad y aunque se frustren y quieran abandonar, no se rindan y podrán entender el por que estos juegos son tan maravillosos.

I’ve never been fan of Dark Souls series. I find them too difficult, unfair and frustrating to begin with. Despite that I read some of the review of Elden Ring and hoped for an epic RPG that is more accessible than Dark Souls.

After 6 hours of played I’m pretty much done with this game. The game is still too frustrating and for a casual gamer for me there just isn’t enough help to get started with this game. The combat is absolutely fluent gotta say that but it’s still too challenging and even though I’ve managed to fell some of the bosses there hasn’t been any rewarding moments. The plot is too mysterious and complex to follow and the game hasn’t given any ”wow”-moments to actually get the player hooked into the game.

I gave it a chance but I’m sad to say it still has all the frustrating sides of From Software and Dark Souls games and this pretty much ruins the game. This was not the worst 69 euros spent but definitely comes to top 3.

To start with, this game probably deserves higher than the rating I am giving it but in the light of biased rave reviews the game has received (which would not be accepted by those reviewers unfortunately), I will also provide a biased review according to me personal taste.

Elden Ring is a dated looking poorly optimized game with interesting and fleshed out character build and combat mechanics that only seems to serve the niche of gamers who like the soulslike formula. I believe this game having a rave metacritic would falsely give the impression that it's appealing for masses of casual gamers hence my review.

As a fan of open world RPG genre carrying many other responsibilities which obliges me to not be able to spare extended stretches of time or entirety of my intellectual capacity to a video game, I found this game to be a poor experience.

There are a few critical points Elden Ring ignores whether it's intentional or not. Game experience is very unguided. You will likely have bad time figuring out how to progress the story or even what the story is, and consequently you will find yourself wandering around weak mobs in a monotone routine if you don't enjoy that kind of tedious exploration. World is quiet desolate and falls into pitfalls Ubisoft RPGs are prevalently considered to fall into while having no cities or areas bustling with energy many other RPGs offer.

Accessibility is very poor. Bosses are quiet challenging to the extent that even an experienced gamer who just doesn't have experience with genre will have nightmare time unless one enjoys attempting a single boss fight for more than a dozen time especially given that there are often no tooltips or guidance on how to make certain fights easier given lack of difficulty options for user to choose. This often requires player to memorize move set of the boss while dying numerous times where poor optimization causes big problems as frame drops hinder the application of this memorization as well. This is in addition to the fact that game requires almost impeccable gaming reflexes to apply any of the move set memorization to an efficient enough degree to win these fights.

Overall, I can see the attraction of this game for the fans of this genre but it is not a game that deserves the acclaim reserved for experiences that can be enjoyed by majority of the overall open world RPG genre like the Witcher 3 or Red Dead Redemption 2 do deserve.

El mejor juego de la saga y probablemente del año, el mundo abierto es una pasada tomando en cuenta el diseño de personajes el arte conceptual del juego da hermosas vistas cada enemigo más fuerte q el anterior y hace una gran dificultad s  te insista a explorar mejorar a tu personaje querer conocer todo en resumen el mejor juego del año

C'est un action donjon RPG assez inspiré de Zelda mais hélas dans la ligne éditoriale détestable de From Software. On y retrouve les mécaniques RPG ringardes pour hardcore gamers comme pas de sauvegarde manuelle ennemis qui se repeuplent dans une zone à chaque utilisation du point de grâce des ennemis à affronter obligatoirement avant le boss.
Toutes ces mécaniques cassent l'immersion dans un jeu en monde ouvert le réalisme y étant aux abonnés absents.
Le jeu traine les défauts obsolètes des Dark Souls qu'il aurait été bien inspiré de laisser de côté. La narration et la direction artistique maîtrisées ne rattrapent pas les défauts primaires du jeu.

After more than 50 hours I'm writing my review of Elden Ring. In my eyes, the game deserves a 10/10 from a Dark Souls fan perspective. About the performance itself. I play it on my XSX in 2K and the 60 fps is stable for me. Only in 4k mode it fluctuates between 45/50-60 fps. Also online works for me from 1 day without problems. It has not worked for many people who came later on the release day because the server capacities were at capacity. From Software probably didn't expect so many players, which of course doesn't excuse it at all. However, it must also be said that this has now been fixed.Graphically, the game is no Horizon Forbidden West, which was never expected. It is a beautiful Dark Souls game.I read a lot of negative reviews here that classify the game as too hard and only got it because of the open world. If you haven't played a Souls game yet, I think you should do so first. For anyone who says it was only rated well by Souls fans, YES BECAUSE IT IS A SOULS GAME. I don't understand the negative review because the game is like Dark Souls, that's what it's supposed to be and I thank From Software for that too. From Software has not only kept its own game concept, they have also improved a lot of the negative things that bothered me about Dark Souls.This is not a generic mainstream sony open world game. Anyone who thinks they are getting a standard Sony open world game like Horizon, Days Gone, etc should stay away from Elden Ring.Anyone who is a fan of the Dark Souls series and especially the first part, this game is a must! Elden Ring is a masterpiece from From Software. They have managed to take the best of their last games and combine it with an incredibly large open world. The game has the atmosphere of Dark Souls 1 (to the point that I feel like I did the very first run of Dark Souls 1, both nostalgia and the childlike joy of exploring an unknown world), it has the movement of Dark Souls with nuances of Sekiro.The open world seems nice but a bit empty and the first dungeons very  (that's how I felt)  , the Souls feeling did not come up immediately. BUT! After 50 hours of playing I understand why this was so at the beginning. The game should go in the mainstream direction whereby newcomers should settle into the game concept in the first area. After the first boss and the first castle, the Souls feeling really kicks in and content is thrown at you. So many different beautiful worlds, secret paths, interesting quests and many many random surprises on his journey there has never been in a Souls game.I haven't played a game that captivated me like this in years.

Only issue I have with this game is the occasional performance issues or frame drops but it happens so infrequently that it barely takes away from the overall experience.
Jaw dropping visuals, incredibly rich and deep lore, gameplay is the best the souls series has seen and the bosses are some of the most impressive ever in gaming period.
I sometimes died because of how cool, badass or beautiful some of the bosses were and it distracted me from dodging the brutal attacks.
This is an open world done right, not just ticking off a checklist of things all generic open world tropes but it an actual well polished and thought out world, everything in it feels like it belongs and it feels so full of life and variety that after 70hours + of playing I'm still finding surprises and I see any sign of that stopping.
FromSoftware have out done themselves and I believe this game will have a spot among one of the greatest games ever made and has a new stepping stone of what an open world can bring pushing the genre forward but also the gaming industry as a whole.
The bar has been raised so high and after writing this review I'm gonna go play Elden Ring some more.
As close to perfection as any game I've play thus far.

Don't listen to the cult, be fully warry of the game you are about to buy. I have fully enjoyed the game but I'm about half way through and frankly, I'm burned out it's just too repetitive.

The Critics reviews for this game, are insane. Have they lost their **** minds? This game is the definition of quantity over quality.

Why is this game immune to basic critiques other games get ROASTED for? Its open world...is bad. Pure and simple. It's big? it's open? But it's 2022 and EVERY open world has to be more than just open and big. The level design is crude and linear. Choice in design amounts to "path with traps" or "path with no traps". To much of dungeons is walking on basic rooftops with no level design whatsoever on them. It's lazy. They should have cut the game in half and focused. Dungeons and villages are copy-paste, traps are crude, there is just too much yet so little outside of the combat.

Which would be fine, if the game weren't acting like it was anything more than just combat.

I honestly do really enjoy this game's gameplay, but for 2022...it's pretty subpar as far as diversity of offerings and complexity of systems. I've gotten about 1/2 the way through (I've done most everything up to entering the Capital and I'm level 90ish) and I'm pretty much burned out. The story, frankly, is just lore...that's it. You've got 1 real story going on and the rest is just set dressing to explain gameplay choices that were already present in Dark Souls...aka, it's not story. There is nothing compelling here. It's just beautiful metaphorical imagery that amounts to pretty much nothing narratively other than a loose allegory for life that's so vague and lacking in substance that it's just boring. They stole the death rune? Neat...what does that mean? That we can revive...that's it. The entire plot is just telling you why you are playing a dark souls game.

At what point does "mysterious" end up just being "vague and empty"...because my experience has been thinking something was coming, and being disappointed OVER and OVER.

I don't want quest logs or map icons telling me where to go, but this game won't even give you enough story context to tell you the next step in a quest. They just give you a dagger and say "give it to the person who owns it"...like what the actual ???? It's like they forgot to finish the game. I have spent a vast swathe of time playing this game, doing nothing but looking up the next step because the game gave me NOTHING and I'm not gonna waste my time searching for a needle in a haystack.

I LOVE solving puzzles, I love piecing together information, I love open story design...my favorite game of all time is Outer Wilds. This game, just frankly sucks outside of the combat (which is still dated)...deeply. The horse controls are pretty mediocre and lack in clarity, bosses are all dodge spam and lack interesting mechanics (I can name like 3 bosses that actually felt neat but 1 of them was so bad at the same time I don't even want to mention him).

I am TOTALLY FINE with how hard this game is...if anything it's the easiest dark souls ever. It's just only a dark souls game.

I do think, for a Souls gamer...this game is gunna be a 10/10...don't hesitate. Buy it.

But for me, a person who has played this kind of game before...I'm just not interested in more of the same.

Being conservative, not pushing your game franchise to be more, that's not something that should be rewarded with the amount of praise this game is getting...there is SO MUCH this game franchise could do to bring out greater gameplay complexity while maintaining its unique stamp. Being open world isn't revolutionary. Not having basic UI elements isn't revolutionary. Telling a vague story badly isn't compelling. These are problems.

This game is deeply overhyped...period. But so are many games, such as BOTW...which was also great in many categories while mediocre in others. However, BOTW was actually innovative. It took risks. This game is a singleplayer MMO from 2004 with better combat. Thats how crude it feels to engage with the world and story and level design. That has to count for SOMETHING in the score.

So I'm sorry but I have to dock this game...it's not perfect, it lacks so much. In a RPG game market that is deeply more complex than this title I don't really see what it is doing so right that it warrants a 10/10...it's just doing so little and pumping out a lot...so that's all games have to be now? That's just what AC is doing and everyone docks AC?...and I like this more than AC...but how is this game dodging the basic criticism the industry applies to every other similar title?

Sifu and Hades has done more to move the Dark Souls formula forward than FromSoft has...it's bad. This isn't the next BOTW, this is just another Dark Souls title. Don't be deluded by the hype
Greatest game I have ever played. It has all the classic soulsbourne elements and then some, and the most detail ed open world of any game.

I’m convinced that these low user reviews haven’t even played the game. Soulless? Uninspired? Bad graphics? None of these things have been an issue for me. Sure the graphics aren’t AAA level, but the art direction more than makes up for that. I haven’t entered a world that has more character to it since Skyrim. This game is brilliant, and is greater than the sum of its parts. Especially weird are the reviews saying “Forbidden West is better”??? This is not a flawless game, but it is still an amazing one. If you give it a chance and have the patience to learn from dying instead of getting angry, then please don’t let the negative user scores throw you off. If you can’t handle dying or don’t like overcoming adversity, then don’t play it. If you like all the aspects and areas of your open worlds thoroughly explained so that there is no mystery or discovery, then this game is not for you. If you are a human being with a brain and an ability to learn and think critically then this game IS FOR YOU.

As a long time fan of Fromsoft's Dark Souls trilogy, Elden Ring takes the cake as the best of them all. I'm naturally a skeptical person and don't go throwing around the phrase "the best" too often. They plucked and dropped some of the best features from all of their past games and beautifully orchestrated them together with an interesting original story and produced a masterpiece. The music in ER is amazing as well and deserves recognition. There are a lot of reviews on here, and all over the internet, that make ER sound like the worst game ever made. A minute sum of these reviews and comments are valid and bring up reasonable points. However, a majority of them are emotionally motivated and charged by the overwhelming popularity this game has imbued. In the end, Elden Ring will go down as one of the greatest ever in-spite of the negative "reviews" a few "gamers" made because they couldn't git gud.

Honestly such an amazing game. I love the fact that you rarely see markers on the map and you can adventure the land to discover stuff on your own. It doesn't have any handholding, nothing that tells you where to go typically. The thing that differentiates this from most other open world games is that the devs of other games want to show you their work, but from wants you to discover it. Its got a huge open world to discover and tons of challenges to face, I feel like the issue most people may have is the fact that its fighting takes time to learn, which makes some encounters really difficult, but other that I love this game.

Elden Ring is more of then a game, it’s an actual story that you get to create, it lets you choose your path and how you get to do it, the freedom is astonishing, and what you can explore to at the start of the game, there are no quest markers and I believe that it is amazing, there’s no task list, there’s no other objective except one, become the Elden Lord, people get upset that there’s no quest marker because they are used to their hand being held, and true, not every game can copy that, but, elden ring let’s you use your imagination. When you figure it out, there’s a click that you get in your head, the narration and item description helps give you a hint, take your time with the game and enjoy, and to the people say the graphics aren’t enough, go outside, the game is beautiful the way it is, you don’t need peach fuzz rendering to make a game like elden ring beautiful, the gameplay is fun because it challenges you, as a vet in the series, I am ecstatic to find the joy I have when I play this game, and to a word to people who say they hate people who love soul like games, my joy outshines that hatred that equals the abyss, in the end though, I love the challenge, I love the time I’ve spent in my first play through, and another side note, sorry if I sound nerdy, this game deserves the praise it gets

I’m guessing people are giving this a score below 6 because they got caught up in the hype and didn’t realise the game was… hard. The visuals are some of the best I have ever seen in a videogame, I bet the people saying it looks like an old Bethesda game have played for about 30 minutes and gave up at the first real boss fight which they didn’t realise was optional. I wish I could post images here. The early game bosses are way harder compared to Dark Souls 3’s early game bosses. Gameplay-wise, it’s mostly like the previous FromSoftware titles. The game is so good that the framerate drops don’t even bother me in the slightest. Buy it, if you’re up for the challenge. I’m going to be playing this game for a very long time since the PvP is so addicting.

I’m a completionist of DS and Sekiro, IMO this is From Software’s closest attempt at making the perfect souls-type game.  Open world significantly exceeded my expectations with visually stunning and varied regions, fighting mechanics aren’t quite as sharp and unforgiving as Sekiro but incorporate some new elements, dying is less inconvenient than in previous souls games, and storytelling has been stepped up while staying true to From’s signature style of starting vague with a big picture and unraveling the details as you go.  Huge replay value.  Easily in my top 5 modern games of all time list.

Pros:Very big and full open world with the game rewarding the player for exploration, boss fights feel engaging and difficult but not impossible.Cons:Drops frames constantly on Xbox SX 60fps mode, feels as if the game would be so much more satisfying given a smooth frame rate.Certain weapons in the game are overpowered and can take the fun out of killing bosses with exploitations leading to over levelled characters (of course you don’t necessarily have to do these however progress does slow down at higher levels).

Having played Demon Souls, Bloodborne, and Sekiro, this isn't my first rodeo with FromSoftware and I'm really digging the NOT HOLDING YOUR HAND APPROACH open world aspect to a souls like game. The UI takes some getting used to but is NOT the garbage that has spewed out of the mouths of prominent developers of other game franchises. (Ubisoft and Guerilla could definitely learn something from this) Story wise it's minimalistic but well done and unique. My medieval fantasy cup of tea. Control wise it's really a matter of understanding the mechanics. If you're not used to souls like mechanics the controls are going to seem poor to you. The graphics are top notch particularly on quality mode. Performance wise...I'm really dissatisfied with it on my Series X. My hope is that FromSoftware steps up to the plate to remedy this. Otherwise this game would be a 10 for me.

El juego es excelente y para ver lo bueno hay miles de review el tema es lo malo y que no lo hace un 10/10 y a mi criterio es, en la exploración muchas veces el objeto a descubrir es un pedazo de planta que no sirve para nada, o un hongo, debieran de haber incluido en estas zonas más materiales de mejora de armas, ya que  es un problema la escasez de los mismos, debido a que por lo general uno va a empezar a mejorar un arma de arranque de la partida y la verdad q no hay forma de saber si el arma encontrada a las 60hs de estar jugando va a escalar mejor o peor que la que tenemos equipada, por lo tanto van quedando relegadas al inventario de a decenas y solo usaremos 4 o 5 en toda la partida, quizás hubiera sido mejor resumir el juego a 12 armas como lo hizo bloodborne. Otro punto negativo son las quest secundarias, en estas si hubiera hecho falta algún tipo de indicador o un guiño del personaje de donde encontrarlo la próxima vez o de que hacer, por que literal es imposible completarlas sin mirar una guía, lo cual le quita al juego ese extra de andar a ciegas y lo convierte en algo monótono el tener q ver una guía, volver al juego ir a ese punto x tener un dialogo, volver a la guía, ver el siguiente paso, volver al juego, hacerlo..... arruina la experiencia. Fuera de eso es un excelente juego y la realidad por ahora es que la dificultad está presente al inicio, una vez alcanzado el nivel 60  con tu arma favorita en +17 algún stat de fuerza o destreza en 40  y unas cenizas de invocación  en +6 la dificultad baja al 50%. Por ejemplo arranque el juego como  es esperado y en lugar de ir a la segunda y tercera zona, me fui para la cuarta el desafío era alto pero la fue peleando y lo completo hasta donde se podía, y luego al ir a las zonas que en realidad eran la 2 y 3, me la estoy pasando matando a enemigos poderosos de 4 golpes   .para resumir tiene una duración monstruosa ya que explorando al 100% y jugando sin guías a la primera recurrendo luego a ellas para sacar el 100 de lo que ofrece cada una de las zonas, con quest incluidas, llevo unas 60 hs y calculo que recién un 50% del juego, y aun sigo enganchado cosa que no me paso con otro mundo abierto

This game is absolutely gorgeous. If you need any help with it, there are tons of great guides and walkthroughs for it. It is HARD! It is also wonderfully balanced, and a truly open world game. Boss too hard? Go somewhere else and get stronger and better. Seriously, just turn and run. No questions asked. If you pay attention to the small details, it can make the game so much easier. Its just absolutely beautiful. This is the first game ive played where if I hit a snag somewhere, I would rather just run around and find things for myself instead of googling a solution. A masterclass in open world design.

Let me start off by saying that I've loved From games for a long time, but Elden Ring jumped the shark for me. The first 60-70% or so of the game is a ton of fun, and I thoroughly enjoyed it. But the boss design, especially in late game is just... mindbogglingly bad. I won't put specifics in here so as to avoid spoilers, but I was feeling so bummed about the state of this game that I created an account here to write this review.

I looked forward to this game for years, but the late game bosses just make it completely unenjoyable. It feels like beating them has nothing to do with skill or learning, but just dumb luck. It feels like From needs to recalibrate their expectations for boss design. I'll probably just play the first 70% of the game or so going forward, but I'm not even sure if I'll stick around for that.

I feel so bummed out about this game. I stayed up late to play it when it released, and felt like a little kid again with how hyped I was. Such a genuine let down to not be able to play through the whole game and enjoy it.
